Skinnibonia, brown and bright,
Consort lean of comely Knight,
Or, to raise thy Title high'r,
Sherriffess of Armagh-shire:
Thou be subject of my quill
Nut-brown pride of Market-hill:
Let me, for I know them well,
All thy various motions tell,
How thy spirits quick extend
To each Toe and fingers end;
Wonder not they travel so,
Little way they have to go,
Skin and bone so closely fixt,
No intruding flesh betwixt.
Now each nimble finger skips
O'r thy Nose, and Chin, and lips,
Or thy Neck with nails respectless
Scratching round a ruby necklace;
While the joggings of thy feet
To thy head in consort meet.
Happy tis that things are thus
For Sr Arthur and for us,
Had thy Skin with flesh been lin'd,
Sure, thy spirits close confin'd,
Wanting room from thence to sally,
In thy dang'rous head would rally:
Where that busy working pate
Might breed factions in the state,
Or instruct thee how to write
Libels on the Dean and Knight.
When the smock-less Nymphs expose
Pairs of legs from knees to toes,
How you scold to see ins. by Swiftthem naked,
Grim'd with dirt by Phebus baked! over?
In what fury when you spy'd
Her that show'd her brown back-side?
How your eyes were fixt upon her
Zealous for your sexes honor! over?
Men might think that every Dame
We overhre she stript would show the same.
Leanest, lightest Skinnibony,
Zephyr's Mistress, Echo's Crony;
Zephyr, when you chanc'd to stoop
Strove to get beneath your hoop,
And to waft you Lord knows where,
To his Palace high in air:
But the Dean with counter-charm
Interpos'd his valiant arm,
Lent a Pin to make all tight;
Zephyr fled with grief and spight.
Echo, from the flanker-wall
Flew to ayd you at your squawl;
Who that saw, must be a witch
To distinguish which was which;
Had it not been after dinner
Skinny would be thought the thinner:
Echo wondred why your bones
Were not yet transform'd to stones:
Said, that Laces and Brocadoes
Were but lost in cloathing shadows;
Stript but off that useless cloathing
Soon your Skin would dry to nothing,
Nor, of woman ought remain
But repeating words in vain.
Echo vow'd she'd be your sister
In good fortune and sinister,
Bear you where no Dean tormentor
Where no teazing Knight would venter;
Round the rocks and clifts to stray,O're the hills and far away;
Ever with your selves conversing,
Or the shepherds plaints rehersing.
Prudent husbands often use
To take down the wedding Shoes;
Certain cure for womens grumbling:
Take down yours to cure your stumbling.
Wonder not you walk a-wry
With each heel six inches high;
But, Sr Arthur I'll maintain
Has good reason to complain:
'Tis a most notorious cheat
Both in measure and in we overhight,
Half a foot of wife together
Clearly lost in wood and leather.
Though, according to the Letter
Iohn takes Ioan for worse or better,
Still it must be understood
What he takes is flesh and blood;
Honest dealers never use
In the count to reckon Shoes:
When for goods inswe in ?Swift's hand, deleting you have contrainscted
Pay for paper and for Packthread!
Now, Sr Arthur, to reduce
This good doctrine into use;
Since a petticoat in fashion
Is nine yard overears by computation,
Get my Lady's heels cut shorter
But four Inches and a quarter;
This will save your honor clear
Twenty pound in Silks a year.!W50800Z
